action.action-desc: Ms. Slotkin (for herself and Mrs. Chavez-DeRemer) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Specialty Crops Competitiveness Act of 2004 to extend and enhance the specialty crop block grants program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Specialty Crop Security Act of 2023.

section.header: Extension and enhancement of specialty crop block grants

subsection.text: Section 101(a) of the Specialty Crops Competitiveness Act of 2004 (7 U.S.C. 1621 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting through priorities jointly identified by specialty crop producers, producer groups, and state program administrators, after specialty crops,.

subsection.text: Section 101(e) of the Specialty Crops Competitiveness Act of 2004 (7 U.S.C. 1621 note) is amended to read as follows:
The State plan shall identify the lead agency charged with the responsibility of carrying out the plan and indicate—

paragraph.text: how the grant funds will be utilized to enhance the competitiveness of specialty crops; and
how outreach to, and consultation with, specialty crop stakeholders will be achieved.

subsection.text: Section 101(l)(1) of the Specialty Crops Competitiveness Act of 2004 (7 U.S.C. 1621 note) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (D), by striking and at the end;
in subparagraph (E), by striking fiscal year 2018 and each fiscal year thereafter. and inserting each of fiscal years 2018 through 2023; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: $100,000,000 for fiscal year 2024 and each fiscal year thereafter.
